image.altText: Kym Valentine stands near venetian blinds, with some light passing onto her face

props.synopsis: Advocates are concerned changes to alcohol delivery laws, which were a recommendation of South Australia's Royal Commission into Family, Sexual and Domestic Violence, are taking too long.

title.children: 'Be brave': DV prevention advocate urges action on delayed alcohol laws

image.altText: Flames and smoke from the Cudlee Creek fire in the Adelaide Hills.

props.synopsis: Victims of the devastating 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, which caused more than $200 million in damage, are seeking compensation from SA Power Networks, alleging the electricity distributor was negligent in the lead-up to the blaze.

title.children: Class action trial over catastrophic Cudlee Creek bushfire begins in SA

image.altText: A man sits in an office and reads a report.

props.synopsis: Australia's next high commissioner to the United Kingdom's time in politics was defined by consultative leadership, pizza politics and a gatecrashed press conference.

title.children: Who is Australia's new top diplomat in the UK?

image.altText: An e-scooter stands on a footpath.

props.synopsis: Changes to road rules allowing e-scooters to be used on some public roads in South Australia are the subject of renewed debate, following the death of a man using one of the devices.

title.children: E-scooter rider's crash death reopens road rule debate in SA

image.altText: Workers atop wind turbines

props.synopsis: It was a moment of euphoria when the world came together to sign a pact on climate action. Ten years on from the 2015 Paris Agreement, we managed to shift the needle. But the problem is, it is just not happening fast enough.

title.children: Temperatures keep climbing, but the world has changed 10 years from Paris

image.altText: Shane Wanganeen is wearing a dark jacket and glasses as he walks along a footpath.

props.synopsis: A man whose young son died after his pneumonia was left untreated is refused bail ahead of his sentencing for criminal neglect, with a judge noting his history of being "persistently non-compliant" while on supervised bail. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the name of a person who has died.

title.children: Father of seven-year-old neglect victim denied bail

image.altText: Emergency department signage at the Lyell McEwin Hospital.

props.synopsis: About 10 per cent of mental health patients in South Australian hospital emergency departments are being kept waiting "more than 35 hours" for a bed, the AMA says.

title.children: Emergency department waits of 35 hours for some SA mental health patients, AMA warns

image.altText: A young woman with glasses puts her arms on top of cabinet

props.synopsis: From late next month, the University of Adelaide and the University of South Australia will begin to cease operations and transform to become Adelaide University. But as the clock ticks, some students and staff are feeling the pressure.

title.children: Students, teaching staff face challenges amid Adelaide University merger

image.altText: The skyline of Adelaide along the River Torrens

props.synopsis: As the UN's annual climate change conference kicks off in Brazil, authorities in Adelaide are still in the dark about whether Australia's fifth-biggest city will be hosting next year's event.

title.children: Adelaide preparing for COP31 on 'incredibly tight timeframe'

image.altText: An airplane dropping a sheet of water, darkening the ground, in a eucalypt forest

props.synopsis: Ahead of bushfire season, the SA Country Fire Service's air operations teams clear out the cobwebs and take to the skies to simulate bushfires in the Flinders Ranges.

title.children: Country Fire Service prepares for summer by taking to the air

image.altText: Kangaroo road sign

props.synopsis: Drivers on regional roads are being warned of an increase in kangaroo activity on South Australian roads, with large mobs of roos seen lining roads at dawn and dusk, creating growing safety concerns for road users.

title.children: 'Dodging them everywhere': Warning to SA drivers over kangaroo risk increase

image.altText: a 100 RMB and a 100 USD currency are displayed on a table with the Chinese and American flags in the background

props.synopsis: Two leading experts on the world's biggest economies warn both countries face serious challenges, and not just over trade with each other.

title.children: US risks AI debt bubble as China faces its 'arithmetic problem'

image.altText: Man in dark suit walking with woman in white suit and man in blue shirt and jacket.

props.synopsis: As Liberals prepare to fly to Canberra to hash out their net zero stance, results from the Australian Election Study suggest those under 45 have continued to drift away from the Coalition.

title.children: Warning signs for Coalition as young voters drift further away

image.altText: An aerial shot of mountain ranges in Guinea with Rio Tinto's Simandou iron ore project being established.

props.synopsis: For decades, China has resented being held hostage over the iron ore price by its own insatiable demand and a handful of Australian producers.

title.children: China succeeds in a decades-long quest to crimp Australian power

image.altText: Emergency services workers on a bridge

props.synopsis: Police believe a woman went to the aid of a child drowning in the creek, before also getting into difficulty on Monday afternoon.

title.children: Woman and child drown in Dandenong Creek in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Rudy Giuliani, wearing a red tie and USA pin on his lapel, frowns as reporters shove microphones towards him

props.synopsis: The US president has pardoned his former lawyer Rudy Giulian and others who were involved in trying to overturn the 2020 election.

title.children: Trump pardons Rudy Giuliani and others involved in efforts to overturn 2020 election

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiles as she hold a wrapped present while standing in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: Toyah Cordingley was "doing something that she would always do", exercising along a secluded Far North Queensland beach when she was violently killed seven years ago, a court in Cairns has been told.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley killed after 'confrontation' on remote Queensland beach, court hears

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price looking upwards, seriously.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was due to speak at the Put Australia First event later this month alongside Tommy Robinson, a one-time member of a fascist political party.

title.children: Nampijinpa Price pulls out of rally with far-right activist Tommy Robinson

image.altText: the us capitol dome lit by the sunset and reflected on a car window

props.synopsis: The US Senate votes in favour of ending the longest government shutdown in the country's history, which has lasted for 40 days.

title.children: US Senate approves bill to end federal shutdown

image.altText: White smoke billows after an explosion at KK Park online scam centre in Myawaddy township, Karen State, Myanmar.

props.synopsis: Myanmar junta bombing of a scam centre is little more than "political theatre" to appease the international community, an expert says.

title.children: Myanmar bombed a massive scam centre — but the industry could be about to hit overdrive

image.altText: two men in suits

props.synopsis: The state's first cross-border commissioner was found dead at his home on Monday morning. Police say his death is not being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Former Queensland police union boss Ian Leavers found dead

image.altText: Anutin Charnvirakul and Hun Manet shake hands as they hold up a signed peace deal.

props.synopsis: The peace deal between the two countries was overseen by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Thailand suspends peace deal with Cambodia after landmine blast injures two

image.altText: A vibrant green bird in grass

props.synopsis: The presence of an endangered and "cryptic" parrot species at a northern Tasmanian national park has been hailed as "very good news" by a bird expert.

title.children: 'Remarkable': Endangered parrot found well outside known habitat

image.altText: Nicolas Sarkozy getting out of a black vehicle parked alongside a house.

props.synopsis: Sarkozy became the first former French president to be sent to prison in modern times, this September.

title.children: French court frees ex-president Nicolas Sarkozy from jail pending appeal

image.altText: A kid in a fedora stands next to police officers.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old is unmasked as the "Fedora man" in a viral image taken outside the Louvre on the day of the crown jewels heist.

title.children: 'Fedora man' pictured at Louvre heist scene unmasked as 15-year-old teenager

image.altText: A row of brand new electric bikes lined up inside a bike shop

props.synopsis: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.

title.children: If your child wants an e-bike or e-scooter, this is what you need to know

image.altText: A woman and man with grey hair lean against each other, looking sadly down at a photo in their hands of a young woman.

props.synopsis: The family of German backpacker Simone Strobel says a second inquest into her death has failed to bring them answers about how and why she died on holiday in NSW 20 years ago.

title.children: Family tormented by murder say 'most important' witnesses did not give evidence

image.altText: Mitchell Starc celebrates a wicket with NSW teammates

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc enjoys a successful return to red ball cricket while representing New South Wales but Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to grab their opportunities.

title.children: Starc sends England ominous warning as Ashes hopefuls fail to fire

image.altText: An empty street with a sign above it for Bristol City.

props.synopsis: These two US cities share a name and a main street, but come election time, following the rules on one side of the road could land you in jail on the other.

title.children: This street is home to two cities with opposite laws and politics

image.altText: Maria Garcia with boxes of food collected from a food bank.

props.synopsis: Unpaid federal workers are turning to food banks and draining their savings as the longest US government shutdown in history drags on.

title.children: 'I didn't vote for this': Millions of Americans go hungry as shutdown hits day 40

image.altText: A group of about sixty people from the NSN dressed in black at a rally outside NSW parliament house in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The federal Member for Wentworth and the NSW Member for Vaucluse posted to social media denouncing the antisemitic rally by Neo-Nazis in Sydney, and offensive messages they received in response have been flagged with police.

title.children: 'Vile abuse' against MPs after Neo-Nazi demonstration referred to police

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and a hat smiles holding an award.

props.synopsis: Alison Thompson was working as an investment banker in New York City when the planes hit the twin towers. She has since powered a global humanitarian movement and today has been recognised for her work.

title.children: How 9/11 and a first-aid kit sparked the newly announced NSW Australian of the Year

image.altText: a plunge pool on a display home.

props.synopsis: A child has died after being found unresponsive in a pool in northern Victoria.

title.children: 8yo boy dies after being found unresponsive in display home pool

image.altText: Donald Trump waves

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is booed by sections of the crowd as he becomes the first sitting US president to attend a regular-season NFL game in nearly half a century.

title.children: Trump booed by crowd at NFL game in Washington
